newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil's real drops 0.28 pct on dollar outflows.
newsitem.headline: Brazil's real drops 0.28 pct on dollar outflows.

text.p: Brazil's real fell 0.28 percent to close at 1.0285 per dollar in the commercial foreign exchange market mostly due to dollar outflows, dealers said.
Preliminary figures for commercial and financial foreign exchange contracts showed a Tuesday deficit of around $50 million.

Although the deficit in the dollar flows was not too large, dealers said the real dropped because the market was expecting another daily surplus and in the afternoon there were not enough dollars to meet demand.
On Monday, net dollar flows posted a $243.2 million surplus, and so far this month flows have accumulated a $1.821 billion surplus.
In the floating exchange rate market, the real closed at 1.0308 per dollar, up 0.03 percent.
In the illegal parallel market, the real fell 0.75 percent to close at 1.078 per greenback due to a combination of an increase in the demand and a reduction in the supply of dollars, traders said.
